abstract: New York City Police Commissioner William J Bratton says he is considering possibility of officers' issuing warnings in lieu of arrests, or even criminal summonses, when dealing with first-time offenders for minor violations of law.
lead_paragraph: The comments by William J. Bratton, the New York police commissioner, came amid a debate over the policing of minority communities and a conversation in the city about altering some practices.

headline.main: Bratton Explores Giving Warnings in Lieu of Arrests for Minor Offenses
headline.print_headline: Bratton Weighs Giving Warnings in Lieu of Arrests for Minor Offenses
